title: Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's (Gloucester, England)
Interview Descriptions: Lady was nice and said she wanted to progress my role. Sadly the HR department would not progress it. I was honest about a previous mistake at an organisation and they held it against me and would not proceed to a further stage. They do not forgive mistakes at this company. So if you want a job you would probably need to lie to them if you said you reason for leaving.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current role?

title: Volunteer Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Derby, England)
Interview Descriptions: simple questions about personality and how i would engage in specific tasks - no minimum requirements to enter job easy to complete and follow through in the process. Interviewer was on old lady very relaxed during the time with a slow paced interview
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Coventry, England)
Interview Descriptions: Just asked what customer service is and diff situations what would you do it was okay and did not take long they got back to me within a week and I got the job
Interview Questions: When can you work What would u do in certain situations

title: Relief Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Belfast, Northern Ireland)
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 3. Each ask a couple of questions. Focus on safeguarding and core values of the company such as working with hope and relevant skills and qualifications including dealing with behaviour and trauma
Interview Questions: Core values of the company

title: Retail Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's (Wolverhampton, England)
Interview Descriptions: Entered the store and was out within 10 minutes, it was a pretty simple and informal chat about why you want to volunteer. From the moment i entered the atmosphere was calm and laidback, it just felt like a talk with a friend.
Interview Questions: why you want to volunteer? what skills you'd like to develop?

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: area manager and another store manager was preset, pretty basic interview questions why want to work here what can you bring to company that sort of thing including some about the company.
Interview Questions: what do you know about Barnardo's

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Arrived in the store, I greeted the manager of the store. She talked to me about my motives for working at Barnardo's and at the end, filled some paperwork agreement for the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer at Barnardo's.

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Interview was good and was offered the position on the same day. Went through all background checks eg. DBS and References etc… I was emailed to say that they could no longer fund my position and this was 4 weeks after I was offered the job. The email stated that I could contact them with any questions which I did as to which I’ve had no response. Why advertise for this position if you could not fund it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Reading, England)
Interview Descriptions: i interviewed with a panel and then viewed the site. i had questions around what i expected the role to be like, relevant previous experience, a question around safeguarding, and what i thought would be involved in the shifts.
Interview Questions: what i thought would be involved in the role

title: Sales Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: online application and form that i had to complete including references and personal information. also had to mention why you would want job. application is remote so no specific questions were asked
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Online due to covid but very friendly and welcoming. Set questions asked and some scenarios. Quick feedback and engaged interviewees. Quick response after interview. Long reference check due to there being a separate team to sort it.
Interview Questions:
How would you respond if a young person said X? 
Why do you want the role?

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Telephone conversation at first then I was invited to an interview. A week after the interview I received a phone call to discuss starting date. The reference check took longer than expected I was then given a great induction on my first day and great support through the first few months to understand the culture and the process
Interview Questions: Safeguarding incident, current legislation and a presentation

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and filled out application form. Few days later was offered interview. It was 20 minute interview 1 to 1 with line manager and service manager in the area I would be working in.
Interview Questions:
Time you worked as a team

Time you worked in a challenging environment 

Questions relating to values

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions:
Very relaxed and comfortable. Asked about the previous job responsibilities and customer-related questions. Took approximately 20 minutes.

Very relaxed and comfortable. Asked about the previous job responsibilities and customer-related questions. Took approximately 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: What are the values of Barnardos

title: Pw2 Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Interview with competency questions, safeguarding scenario and an EDI question.  Friendly interviewers.   Needed to do a short presentation, all online via Zoom.  Interview lasted for 45 mins with opportunity to ask questions.  Felt at ease.
Interview Questions: What strengths will you bring to this role?

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Very well managed and checked if reasonable adjustments were needed.   Friendly approach and  quick feedback.   Team were lovely and extra time given on IT task.   Form easy to navigate. Regular updates. Choice of interview slots.
Interview Questions: Experience of working with young people

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Online application, selection meeting and induction which involved reading a lot of things, singing some forms and touring the store. The online application is fairly straightforward and involves filling in personal details, answering some basic questions .  You also have to provide two references. I received an invite to a selection meeting shortly after submitting my application.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer at Barnados

title: Retail Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The manager will supply you with an interview date. You decide whether it is convenient for you and get back to them via email. Barnardo's is flexible around the hours you're available.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a retail volunteer?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Quite easy just asked why I wanted to volunteer and then showed me around and explained safety protocols. Very very nice people all so happy and ready to help others
Interview Questions: Why do u want to volunteer here

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Newcastle, England) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Attended interview via Zoom. Two days before interview I still hadn't received link to interview so contacted HR, only to receive the link in an email around 10.20pm night before. Told by manager conducting the interview that HR Centre will inform me of outcome; waited almost a week, so decided to email HR enquiring if a decision had been made and further clarification. Within 10 minutes received a standard 'unfortunately on this occasion you have been unsuccessful' email reply. I think someone had forgot to let me know and it was only my email that prompted their reply!
Interview Questions: Explain why you would be suitable candidate for the role?

title: Retail Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: About me and about the shop. Given a tour of the shop and then given a taster session. Had to complete online training on the website about the workplace.
Interview Questions: What would you like to get from working here.

title: Nursery Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Excellent communication with the interviewer, straightforward and simple. They explained the role in great detail and showed interest in my experience in the field. Quick process when it comes to dbs check and reference requests. Very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Retail Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: It was alright. I found it easy and there was no hard questions. There were basic questions. They told me to come for an induction day afterwards. The manager was really friendly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Retail Assistant Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions:
Give you a sheet of questions to fill in and ask you some simple questions but it’s a very informal interview and it’s just to get to know a bit about you

After that you have a trail day and tour around the shop, 

They also call your references and ask them a couple questions on why you would be suitable
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Relatively simple and friendly, like a chat. I'm really sorry I just need to submit this to look at reviews so  this is the only thing I've actually done
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Family Aide Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Leeds, England) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: 45 minutes, panel of 3, 3 questions from each.  Offered interview within a week of applying. The interview felt quite rushed. No opportunity to talk about myself, my career development, or why I wanted the job. No mention of values, basis or strategies even though I was asked to know about them.  Haven’t heard outcome yet
Interview Questions: Scenario- how would you engage a reluctant mother?

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Cardiff, Wales) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Straightforward interview with 8 competency based questions and a case study to discuss which gets sent to you 10 minutes prior.

However, 3 weeks after the interview I’d not heard anything. I contacted both my interviewers directly to ask for an update; a further 10 days later and they never replied. Disgraceful way to treat people, especially for a company that prides itself on compassion.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you responded to a safeguarding concern.

title: Retail Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, put at ease, just tried to be myself,  was offered job days later and accepted, researched company thoroughly beforehand, I did not find it a difficult interview, friendly and relaxing
Interview Questions: Tell me about barnardos core values

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Case study and interview took place via zoom.  Panel lacked integrity and were racist in their approach . Panel took awhile coming back with the decision and lack of feedback
Interview Questions: Why applied for the role

title: Trainee Cbt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Birmingham, England) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: positive, clear experience.  applied online, 2 stage interview, one with the service and second with uni. process took about 6 weeks from initial application to final interview.   Questions were relative to the role. Its all about your personality so make sure you let them see that.
Interview Questions: skills, knowledge, experience, risk and some questions on values of the service.

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a fine process. it was good and an easy application there was no problem an employer is a nice person and didn't stress you on the question. You also had to read a lot if you got the job.
Interview Questions: why i chose this job

title: Employability Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Edinburgh, Scotland) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward recruitment and interview process and efficient, ensuring application made and interview process were made and reviewed in timely fashion.  Online interview was very straightforward and interview questions were standard.
Interview Questions: Straight forward question based on SMART answer responses.

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Wasn’t too hard just showed me around the store and told me about the role, how to use the full etcetra- no job style interview questions didn’t really need any preparation
Interview Questions: Are you religionless to work

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was invited to a informal selection meeting. The questions asked were mainly in regards to my availability, holidays booked and the responsibilities as a volunteer at Barnardo's.
Interview Questions: Have you got any holidays booked?

title: Retail Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Newport, Newport, Wales) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: it was quite non-formal and friendly, I got asked a few simple questions and was told what my responsibilities were, we also went over what shifts i would be working and general health and safety rules.
Interview Questions: why did you choose to apply for this role?

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England)
Interview Descriptions:
Appalling, frustrating and chaotic.

I applied online and recieved an email asking me to go to their website to select an interview slot.

When I went to the site it required me to fill in a number of additional forms before allowing me to proceed to select a slot (not a big deal but would have been good to mention).

When I got to the select a slot part of the site there were no interview times uploaded.  I emailed to tell them that there were no slots for me to select from.

About 10 days passed before I recieved a reply saying that the interview panel were not available on alternative days to those listed and therefore they would not be proceeding with my application.

Awful recruitment process.

Don't waste your time.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Delivery Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions:
90 min process. I was given a set of questions to go over for 30 mins and prepare my answers. Followed by a 5 min presentation delivered by me and then 55 mins asking the questions I was presented with.

The panel entered the room and sat opposite me in silence. They made me feel awkward the moment they walked in which prompted me to introduce myself. During my presentation I was met with a series of awkward glances and expressions which i felt was off putting. It so happened that she was to ask questions which, even after I had answered, she seemed to want me to answer differently as if my previous answer was utter nonsense!

The interview over ran and we had to move into another room. Needless to say, I received an email 4 days later to say I was unsuccessful. 
After emailing them to ask for feedback I was met with no response.

It was confidence crushing for the following reasons:

1. This would have been the 3rd time I interviewed with Barnardo's.

2. My previous interview for Portfolio Manager was met with fantastic feedback and I felt the panel for that interview made me feel so comfortable where I was able to deliver.

3. During every question, my responses were met with interruption and expressions like they had bitten into a lemon.

I have no interest in applying here again.
Interview Questions: Once established in the role, describe how you would operate to ensure ongoing success.

title: RHI Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about two weeks later recieved an email asking me to attend an  interview face to face with line manager and senior manager. Both were very friendly and made me feel at easy. The inerview questions were standard ones and I was called two days later and offered the job.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Training Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Good process and communication prior to the interview. Quick to respond and provide feedback and inform if I had been successful. They were also happy to answer any questions that I had.
Interview Questions: How would you react in a safeguarding scenario?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Cambridge, England) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't stressful at all. saw the ad online applied on the company website and less than 3 weeks later I was invited for a face-face interview. The store manager and the area business manager asked me a series of standard questions. Company values, asked about my previous experience in sales...
Interview Questions: How would you handle a crisis if your manager was off duty?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really quick, with most of the usual interview questions. Nothing came up that was a big surprise. They mostly cared about confidentiality and how you deal with having to read emotional information.
Interview Questions: Most of the usual interview style questions: strengths, weaknesses, why your previous experience will help in the job etc.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: They ask basic identification questions, then asked about why I'd want this job. Am I good with talking to people, what retail training I had and about my flexibility. Just your generic questions I suppose.
Interview Questions: "Have you had any retail training"

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Competency based questions, scored. Informal setting in the brake room with a store manager and area manager. Interviewers were friendly, seemed genuinely interested in my previous retail experiences. Questions were scripted but was also asked unscripted followup questions on some points
Interview Questions: Tell us why you are right for this job

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Nottingham, England) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applies online through their own website and received invite to book an interview at the store the vacancy was at. They stated on the vacancy what date interviews were on. Only notified two days before the actual interview.  Interview itself was about 45 minutes and was told they let all candidates know either way the following week. That was 3 weeks ago and nothing from them, very unprofessional and if they cannot tell the truth about a simple thing like that then I'm not sure I would want to work for them now anyway!
Interview Questions: Have you worked with KPI's before?

title: People Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Shambolic - was offered job, they withdrew it. The manager went on leave and didn't tell me who to contact someone then contacted me saying it had been withdrawn because they hadn't heard from me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Ilford, England) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted for an interview within the same week. the interview lasted 30 mins and was competency based questions, also ensure to have knowledge on safeguarding and child protection as well as their Basis and Values.
Interview Questions: what are their Basis and Values?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Belfast, Northern Ireland) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an invitation to interview fairly soon afterwards. Smooth process. The panel was comprised of 3 people from 3 different departments and I was required to answer questions by all of them which I was not really prepared for as I expected it would be centred entirely upon the position I had applied for.
Interview Questions: Questions were based upon specific skills (organisational, communication, etc.) . When discussing my experience, they often replied by asking what SKILLS were involved.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Birmingham, England) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
new online recruitment system - relatively simple to use
there was a panel interview and young persons panel which was an interesting approach. none of the questions were particularly taxing
that's about it
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager and on of the senior managers, with a series of questions about strengths and weaknesses, my experience and why I would be a good fit for the company.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Barnardo's

title: CYP IAPT CBT Therapist Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Birmingham, England) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Online application process and then required to come in to speak to a panel of 3 - 1 would be a manager, one of the lecturers from the university where you would study and also a therapist who you would do your placement with
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself? Why should we hire you? More about finding out about the type of person you are

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Doncaster, England) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Short and sweet, a few questions common Sense needed! The lady made me feel very comfortable in the interview, you will need to take ID also photo copies of it
Interview Questions: If your on your own and have a delivery there’s a big box you can’t move on your own, what should you do?

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Area Manager and a store manager was present taking notes. Described the job role to me, hours etc. Asked my flexibility as overtime is available. Asked a bit about previous experience and important- research their values and morals as a company as they will ask you what you know about them. Asked about holidays booked, notice period and training.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Barnardo's/why do you want to work for us?

title: Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: started off with a scenario based presentation task (given 45 mins to plan) followed by interview with 2 panel members who took turns to ask interview questions. Ten mins were allocated to presenting the scenario based task
Interview Questions: mainly scenario based questions - must have past experience specific to question

title: Shop Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Bolton, England) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by both the area manager and acting store manager, in a friendly manner. Lots of 'what did you do/what would you do in this scenario' type of questions. Reviewed my CV history.
Interview Questions: Explain a scenario in the past where you had to deal with a conflict and what you did to bring it to a solution?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Bristol, England) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was nice with friendly approach,  asked about experience, job and Value. but they did not call back ,no feed back disappointing . I was called twice for interview and no offer was given. I would not recommend very unprofessional,at least  email with feedback
Interview Questions: tell me about your self

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, contacted by Barnardos to attend an interview. The interview was very relaxed and casual, the questions were mainly based on past experiences in previous jobs and how these would apply to a roll in Barnardos.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are right for Barnardos.

title: Customer Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The recruitment process is certainly not with the times. You have to fill out a word document form that could take several hours to complete. The recruitment team had driven me mad by then asking me to backdate all references in the last 5 years, and they wouldn't accept that one of my previous companies moved offices and difficult to reach. After giving me a job offer they then withdrew my application. Never apply for a job with them again!
Interview Questions: Q1. What do I know about the charity industry and some of the challenges.

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: 45 mins approximately, took place in the back room of the store. Was good, as interviews go! As long as you are prepared you will be fine.  Treat the interview as a chance to show off the very best side of you!
Interview Questions: Good and bad examples of Customer service

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Stevenage, England) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Friendly , relaxed and nice. I have to face interview with two people.  Even English is not my mother language they still very patient to listen to me.
Interview Questions: What's barnardos basic and value

title: Corporate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
very drawn out- lots of chasing. kept  waiting.for updates, panel changed, date changed. almost withdrew. 
 panel were friendly and welcoming. on the day it ran smoother, well managed by HR person or administrator who was supporting.
Interview Questions: about what I would do differently in a particular situation

title: Service Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Leeds, England) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The interview lasted about 30 minutes and was fairly informal, with an interview panel of three people including the Service Manager, Team Leader and Assistant Finance Manager.

There was also a 30 minute test on finance administration.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your skills and experience, and how these can be transferred into the role of Service Administrator?

title: Play and Leisure Buddy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Rhyl, Wales) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly relaxed. Was asking 10 questions. Was interviewed by two people, both asked 5 situational questions. Interview was around 30 minutes long. Not too difficult. Would recommend reading on Barnardo's values. Was given the job on the day of the interview.
Interview Questions: Was asked about 10 situational questions, e.g 'what would you do to make a child feel included in activities?'

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Birmingham, England)
Interview Descriptions: Took 1 week to get interview... area manager really good... store manager is kind happy easy going... they ask If you know about the company's bases and values... if you don't research and don't know you will probably not get the job.... they seem look a good company... the pay is really fantastic especially for retail too
Interview Questions: Do you know company's bases and values

title: Family Support Worker (Project Worker I) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Atherstone, England) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
In tray test - pretty standard to test your priority skills. Although left to do it in staff kitchen and was told I wouldn't be disturbed as there was a sign in the door. Interrupted twice by staff.
Kept waiting for about 30-45 mins for panel interview. Chilly corridor.
Discussed reasons for priority setting for in tray test. No issues. 
Questions from panel of 3 were tough. Only 1 of them attempted to put me at ease.
Most questions related to legislative stuff around safeguarding which is understandable. They didn't ask anything about Barnardos as an organisation which they had suggested you read up on for the interview in their invitation details. 
Looking back, the job description was very vague and it was clear they wanted someone who was very experienced and knew the job already rather than someone with less experience who could grow with it. 
It felt very cold/bland, no attempt to find out about me as a person or previous experience could bring to the role. 
Disappointed.
Interview Questions: Something to do with Domains! Didn't have a clue and can't remember the rest of the question. Was told I either knew it or I didn't!

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Swansea, Wales)
Interview Descriptions:
I met at the service with the Manager and another member of staff. We began the interview then they realised I was not the applicant they thought so had to go outside and return when the other applicant had finished. 

The interview was okay, the panel were quite abrupt and one of them rolled her eyes when I spoke about the work I had done with vulnerable people, which was very unprofessional. I knew by the atmosphere and their responses that I hadn't got the job. The job description stated administration experience wasn't essential but it was clear they were looking for someone who was experienced. 

I applied online and heard back from the company around a week after the closing date. I was given 10 days to prepare for the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where one of the young people accessing the service was drunk and disorderly?

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Warrington, North West England, England)
Interview Descriptions: The recruitment process was very easy to follow, the interview process was a very good experience, area manager was very professional, felt comfortable throughout whole process, all in all a positive experience, the questions related to my experience and skills and were easy to answer, the area manager had good knowledge of interview procedures.
Interview Questions: Barnardos core values and what they stand for.

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and straight forward. They called up my references and called me in after.  After a few minutes, I was offered the job. I got to work the next day. The supervisor interviewing me was friendly and walked me through my role.
Interview Questions:
What key skills do you have?
What experience do you have?
How would you deal with complaints?
What do you know about Gift Aid?

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Plymouth, England) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Structured  interview  asking  questions  about  what  I  have  done,  or  would  do  in  specific  situations.  Friendly  interviewer,  whole  process  was  positive  even  though  I  didn't  get  an  offer.
Interview Questions: How  would  you  cope  if  you  were  the  only  trained  member  of  staff  on  duty ?

title: Store Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Filled out an application form then I applied to be a volunteer but I got an interview for the store associate job. The entire process took a week.
Interview Questions: How would you summarise and apply Barnados basis and values to your job?

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The questions reflected the job description. The job description did not reflect the job.
The job description was generic with a customised blurb. The blurb was poorly thought through.
The interviewers did not know very much about the profession and the panel changed the interview date and then the interview started late as a member of the panel didn't arrive for quite some time.
Interview Questions: Safeguarding

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They asked a number of basic questions and followed up with scenario questions at the end about safeguarding, working with families. They asked me about what I knew concerning harmful sexual behaviours. An example of working with a young person or child displaying these behaviours. Also, asked about the approach you would take when working with young people.
Interview Questions: Describe what abilities or knowledge you have that makes you a suitable candidate?

title: Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Competency based interview at HQ, based largely off of the job description - 'tell us how you would/give us an example of a situation where you...'. Very friendly and relaxed. Got back to me with an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Can you please tell us about an event you organised where you had to deal with unexpected challenges and how you dealt with that.

title: Family and Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Third degree type interview process
One question became three
Questions asked in the longest way possible
Didnt make me comfortable or relaxed, having reach interview early, still waited 30 minutes passed interview time, which made me more nervous!!
Interview Questions: How would you get volunteeers involved?

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: I had a face to face interview with two people.  The interview was very relaxed and I felt at ease . I then had a telephone interview with the area manager
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Online Community Project Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Liverpool, England) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 interview process with a task on the second interview.  The third interview was with the project manager. Everyone was lovely and kind in the recruitment process and made me feel welcome.
Interview Questions: why do you work in this sector

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Presentation and then multiple interview questions about the post applying for and specific questions around equality, diversity and inclusion, Barnardo's values and managing a team of diverse volunteers, how to recruit diverse volunteers and how best to support volunteers.
Interview Questions: How do you work with and meet Barnardo's values?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Crystal Palace, England) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview took 30 mins and it was like you speak to a friend, which was very nice. I did not feel like I'm having interview, but more like I meet friends.
Interview Questions: questions about me, what I know about the company.

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Airdrie, Scotland) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Competency Interview. Was my first interview for around 1 year, they didn't make me feel very relaxed though. Nice enough women, however one was just a little condescending towards me which obviously didn't help my nervousness. Told me they would contact me that night or the next day and I didn't hear from them until around 1 week later.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions:
Standard Application form and personal statement. About a week after the closing date I got invited to interview. I thought the interview process was good, giving candidates an opportunity to show their abilities through different methods - there was a presentation, a written case study task and an interview. It meant that if you are not great at one aspect there are other opportunities to shine. All took place in one session which lasted about 90 minutes. 

The panel were friendly and supportive and helped me feel at ease. I felt like they wanted to see my best side and help me relax. Had to take lots of documents along to interview and fill in lots of paperwork, but this is pretty standard for working with children. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time that a safeguarding issue came up at work and how you dealt with it

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions:
A standard set of questions asked at every interview with a few inappropriate unfair personal questions thrown in.
The questions are scored out of 5. But there is no way of knowing how or why you scored less/more than colleges
Interview Questions: Will your relationship with other staff (friends) effect your professionalism

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Birmingham, England) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: hit and miss online system, fairly informal 2 person interview, standard  "stock"questions, didn't go out of their way to put you at ease or be friendly and certainly didn't tell you the truth about what the job entails
Interview Questions: what do you know about our basis and values and how do you implement them

title: Customer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Hartlepool, England) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was invited to interview via email. The interviewers were late, and didn't know which order the interviews were taking place. They asked about retail experience, what I knew about Barnardo's and how I thought they recruited their volunteers. I was also asked about profit and how I would ensure that the business was successful.
Interview Questions: The question's about profit and the business side of things.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Chelmsford, England) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, filled out a form with the manager in the room at the back. She went through the form with me and asked the questions, I answered and she wrote down what I said. The interview was pretty quick and she explained to me what I would be doing when volunteering at the shop, as well as mentioning some safety rules.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer at Barnardo's?

title: Short Breaks Service Evaluation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Barnardo's (London, England) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online through online application in March and then called to in-person interview in June

Online application is detailed, asking for around 200 word responses to different questions
In-person interview was 1 hour long, given some time alone to prepare answers to questions

Make sure to have all forms of ID and DBS check to speed application process along.
Interview Questions:
-difference between qualitative and quantitative methods
-how/why would you need to respect privacy and discretion
-what is your awareness of disabilities like Asperger's?

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Gorleston-on-Sea, England) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Considerably easy, asked me whether the information provided on the cv was correct regarding time with company 43 years & vehicle maintenance regarding up keep of safety of vehicle. But disagreed with the weight i could lift.
Interview Questions: Would there be any heavy lifting required.,as the job was advertised 8kg maximum clothing only.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Ormskirk, England) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a one on one interview where i was asked why i wanted to volunteer for a childrens charity. By the end of the interview i was asked when i could start work and shown around
Interview Questions: Why did i want to work with barnado

title: Sunday Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Manchester, England) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and it was very pleasant. Two managers from different Barnardos stores came to interview me. They asked questions about the ethics and values of Barnardos, stressing on diversity a lot. They asked me competency questions to gain information with regards to my personality, and how I can deal with hypothetical problematic issues. They had also asked about my flexibility, and where I am to be in 5 years time.
Interview Questions: What are the main ethics and values of the company

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Belfast, Northern Ireland) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Came in an had one on one with interviewer. They were friendly, and explained more to me about the job. Asked a series of relevant questions such as my experience. Told me I would her back with 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Recent experience

title: Intern Marketing Analytics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Barnardo's
Interview Descriptions: A regular competency interview with 2 staff discussing past experience and relevancy with the position. Very friendly and relaxing. The internship is 5 days per week full time without pay.
Interview Questions: No difficult question. Just give examples of teamwork, taking initiative, meeting deadline, etc

title: Residential Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Wokingham, England) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a paperwork excersises as I had already told I had the job as they wanted Male staff. The senior manager knew my family so asked that I come in. Informal chat and a discussion about pay (I wasn't qualified but knew I would be getting more than other staff)
Interview Questions: How are you?

title: Brm Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Barnardo's (Chester, England) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: read their  job site memorise their basis and values come across as professional and don't worry about it. They are so desperate to fill their vacancies that they will take anyone on.
Interview Questions: How would you get more stock?
